hero.title: Calm, client-led coaching for real-life change
hero.subtitle: A steady, non-directive space to think clearly, choose next steps, and move at your pace—without hype.

audiences.title: Mid-career returners
audiences.description: Co-create a realistic plan to re-enter work with confidence and care.

audiences.title: Newcomers to the UK
audiences.description: Reflect on norms, choices and practical moves in context, without judgement.

audiences.title: Graduates
audiences.description: Turn uncertainty into small, testable next steps you design and own.

audiences.title: Parents returning to work
audiences.description: Rebuild rhythm with gentle structure, reflection and accountability.

process.title: Intro chat
process.description: We clarify aims, boundaries and fit. You choose the topic; we agree how we'll work.

process.title: Focused sessions
process.description: Typically 4–6 × 50–60 minutes. You lead; we partner to evoke awareness and options.

process.title: Review and next steps
process.description: We reflect on learning, adjust the plan and agree what support you want next.

faqs.question: Is coaching the same as therapy or counselling?
faqs.answer: No. Coaching is future-focused and client-led. We do not assess, diagnose or treat. If therapy seems more appropriate, we will signpost respectfully.

faqs.question: Do you give advice?
faqs.answer: We are non-directive. We may offer observations or frameworks with your permission, but you decide what to do.

faqs.question: Is it confidential?
faqs.answer: Yes, within legal and safeguarding limits. We explain confidentiality and data handling in our agreement.

faqs.question: How many sessions will I need?
faqs.answer: Many people start with 4–6 sessions. We review together and you decide what is useful.

faqs.question: Can sessions be recorded?
faqs.answer: Only with your explicit consent and for a clear purpose. Otherwise, we do not record.

faqs.question: Do you follow a code of ethics?
faqs.answer: Yes. We work to the ICF Code of Ethics and core competencies.
